LEMON BARS DELUXE  

2 c. flour
1/2 c. powdered sugar
1 packet True Lemon, divided (optional)
1 c. butter
4 eggs, well beaten
2 c. sugar
1/3 c. freshly squeezed lemon juice
2-3 drops pure lemon oil (optional)
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1/4 c. flour
Grated rind of 1 lemon (optional)

Mix first 3 ingredients using half of the True Lemon packet (optional). Using a pastry blender or two knives, cut in butter as you would when making pie crust until it resembles coarse crumbs.

Press crumb mixture into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake in a preheated 350?F oven for 15-20 minutes.

Combine the remaining ingredients (and the other half of the True Lemon packet) to make the lemon filling.

Pour over crust and bake for 25 minutes at 350?F or until lightly golden on top. Sprinkle with powdered sugar when cool.

Cut into bars.

Submitted by: CM

Excellent recipe for lemon bars. Much better than recipes which don't call for flour in the top batter. Omitted lemon in the base. Great texture. Easy.

Someone in your local supermarket will know where they keep the True Lemon boxes. You could try the sugar and baking section.

I usually find it where the powdered drinks are shelved.

I have never heard of True Lemon either, but a quick search led me to their website (www.truelemon.com) and they have a store locator which even tells you where in your local store the item can be found (well, for some of the stores).
Jun 12, 1:19 AM
Lise (Washington) says:
And they also make True Orange and True Lime. I love this product and have been wishing for a real lime/lemon juice in powder form so that it can be used on other foods/recipes that would otherwise be ruined by a liquid juice. Might I suggest trying it on your popcorn (yum!). I know you all will have your favorite, creative recipes just waiting for this :)
